page.title: 03Population
page.content: In 1840 Gilford Mill was built. When it was opened the population increased rapidly, so Dumbar and McMaster the owners built three streets: Ann St., High St., and Hill St. People came from Fermanagh, Monaghan and Armagh to work in Gilford Mill. So many people from Keady lived in Hill St. that the locals called it Keady Row. Even after it has been demolished people still call it Keady Row. Many people died in the great famine between 1845 and 1850. To help the people who had the fever, Dunbar and McMaster converted two houses in Keady Row into a hospital. Dr McBride was the doctor in the hospital. Keady Row was demolished but was rebuilt again. The old houses were built of red brick which were made in the brick yard which was to the rear of Castle Hill. The population of the area is about 6000.
